titleInfo.title: Brought to the Police Prison, 1st District.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the Police Prison, 1st District, CHARLES, a griff, about thirty-one years old, five feet seven and three-quarter inches high, has a large scar on left cheek and bald on back of head from a scald. Says he belongs to Mr. Draper, near Columbus, Arkansas. ELIZABETH, a mulattress, about twenty-three years old, five feet one inch high, has scars on both arms. Says she belongs to Mr. Delway. HENRY, a mulatto, about twenty-nine years old, five feet three and a half inches high, has a small scar on forehead and on left check. Says he belongs to Mr. Pickerell. MARIA, a griffe, about thirty-seven years old, five feet two inches high, scar on right eye, fore-finger off right hand, and smal finger off the left. Says she belongs to Mr. Claa. PEGGY or REBECCA, a black, about twenty-four years old, five feet high, scars on forehead and on the wrists. Says she belongs to Mr. Segal. THOMAS, a black, about forty-six years old, five feet five inches high. Says he belongs to Mr. Robertson. The owners will please comply with the law respecting them. NewOrleans, May 4, 1852--my5 1aw3w J. Worrell, Warden
mods.note: Mr. Draper; Mr. Delway; Mr. Pickerell; Mr. Clapp; Mr. Segal; Mr. Robertson
Charles (31); Elizabeth (23); Henry (29); Maria (37) Peggy or Rebecca (24); Thomas (46)

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
